result.execSummary:
The defendant Silverio A. Moreno was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Repeated Sexual Assault of Same Child (At Least 3 Violations of 1st Degree Sexual Assault), a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.025(1)(d).
  • Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).
  • Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).
  • Cause Child <13 to View/Listen Sex. Act., a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.055(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *AMENDMENT 8/6/2019 - Judgment of Conviction amended to reflect sentence credit in the amount of 568 days.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs.   If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
---------------------------------

No contact with any minors unless approved by the Agent and the parents of the minor. 
---------------------------------
No contact with the victim or her family and no contact with the other two girls or their families without both their and the Agent's consent.
---------------------------------
Not to view or use the Internet for any purpose other than those specified by the Probation Agent.
---------------------------------
No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
---------------------------------

Participate in any counseling recommended including sex offender treatment and evaluations determined to be necessary.
---------------------------------
Comply with the sex offender registry.
---------------------------------
Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
---------------------------------

Temporary Commitment form filed

10:07 am  Court in session.  Case cased.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Silverio A. Moreno in court, in custody with attorney Michelle Marie Anderson.  
Defendant is being assisted by an Interpreter.  There are also victims present who are receiving assistance of the interpreter.  
Matter is before the Court for sentencing.  Court makes record with regard to charges and penalties.  Court makes further record as to the documents that have been reviewed by the Court.  
10:10 am  Atty Anderson makes record as to documents she has reviewed with Mr. Moreno.  She has no additions or corrections to the PSI or to the assessment of Dr. Westendorf.  
10:10 am  ADA Johnson makes record with regard to compliance with victim's rights.  She has reviewed the PSI and Dr. Westendorf's assessment and does not have any corrections.  
10:11 am  Statement by Mark Campbell, father of victim.  
10:16 am  Court has read the victim impact statements.  
10:17 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Johnson.  
10:30 am  Argument as to sentence by Atty Anderson.  
10:47 am  Defendant indicates he doesn't have anything to say.  
10:47 am  Court takes brief recess to consider this matter.  

11:00 am  Court in session.  Same Appearances.  
11:00 am  Court proceeds with making its record and sentencing the defendant.  

SENTENCE:  
Ct #1:  16 yrs IC followed by 10 yrs ES for total sentence of 26 years; 
Ct #2:  2 yrs IC followed by 2 yrs ES, consec. to Ct #1;  
Ct #3:  2 yrs IC followed by 2 yrs ES, conc. with Ct #2, consec. to Ct. #1;  
Ct #4:  2 yrs IC followed by 2 yrs ES, conc. with Cts #2 and #3, consec. to Ct. #1;  

CONDITIONS OF ES:  
1)  Participate in any counseling recommended including sex offender treatment and evaluations determined to be necessary.  
2)  No contact with any minors unless approved by the Agent and the parents of the minor.    
3)  No contact with the victim or her family and no contact with the other two girls or their families without both their and the Agent's consent.  
4)  Not to view or use the Internet for any purpose other than those specified by the Probation Agent.  
5)  Maintain employment.  
6)  Comply with the sex offender registry.  
7)  No alcohol.  No illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.  
8)  No weapons.  
9)  Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.  
10)  Pay court costs and DOC supervision fees.  

Court warns defendant:  1)  May not vote;  2) May not possess firearms;  3)  May not possess body armor;  4)  May not work or volunteer with children (Sec. 948.13);  
Discussion concerning deportation warning.  Court advises defendant that conviction could result in deportation.  
11:29 am Court in recess.

8:34 am  Court in session.  Case Called.  Appearances are the same.  
BAILIFFS:  George Clettenberg and Sharri Loveless.  
INTERPRETER for Defendant:  Sara Chwaszczewski and Judy Veramendi - sworn by Clerk prior to start of trial;  
INTERPRETERS for victim's family:  Claudia Lizarallde;  
8:34 am  Discussion between Court and Attys re:  Jury Instructions;  
8:39 am  Court has colloquy with Atty Anderson and the Deft regarding whether or not he will testify.  Mr. Moreno does wish to testify.  Court finds Mr. Moreno is freely, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily choosing to testify.  Atty Anderson has had an opportunity to speak with both her client and his wife regarding their testimony.  
8:45 am  Jury seated in courtroom.  
8:47 am  Maria de las Mercedes Moreno is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Anderson.  Sara Chwaszczewski interpreters for witness.  
9:16 am  Atty Johnson has no questions of this witness.  Witness excused.  
9:17 am  Silverio Moreno Diaz is sworn by Clerk.  
9:19 am  Jurors excused from courtroom for a short break.  Court questions why Defendant had shackles on?  Response by Deputy Beecroft.  
9:33 am  Court in session with Attys and the defendant.  Court makes record.  
9:34 am  Atty Anderson makes record with regard to the shackles and would like opportunity to make an expanded record with case law.  
9:36 am  Response by Atty Anderson to Court's questions as to whether she had noticed the shackles.  
9:38 am  Continued discussion between Court and Attys.  Response by Atty Johnson.  
9:41 am  Court will allow defense to bring further argument later when they have opportunity to review case law.  Court makes record as to its review of case law.  
9:42 am  Jury returns to courtroom.  
9:43 am  Mr. Moreno testifies on direct exam of Atty Anderson.  
10:14 am  Cross exam by Atty Johnson.  
10:21 am  Redirect by Atty Anderson.  
10:25 am  Witness excused.   
10:25 am  Defense rests.  
10:25 am  State has rebuttal witnesses and asks for a short break.  Jury excused from courtroom.  
10:25 am  Court takes short break.  

10:43 am  Court in session with Attys and Defendant.  Court makes further record with regard to shackles issue.  
10:44 am  Atty Johnson makes further record.  Atty Anderson reserves right to put case law on the record.  Court proposes giving a curative instruction to the jury when she instructs the jury.  
10:45 am  Jury returns to courtroom.  
REBUTTAL:  
10:47 am  Det. Lambert is sworn and testifies on exam of Atty Johnson.  
Exhibit 36 mark and identified;  
Exhibit 36 is offered - objection by Atty Anderson that there are other photos shown on the page.  
10:50 am  Jury excused from courtroom.  
10:51 am  Atty Johnson will be able to show just the 2 referenced photos on the page.  Atty Johnson makes further record describing photos that will be shown.  Atty Anderson withdraws her objection.  
10:52 am  Jurors return to courtroom.  
10:52 am  Continued exam of Det. Lambert by Atty Johnson.  
10:54 am  Atty Anderson has no questions of this witness. Det. Lambert is excused.  
10:55 am  State rests.  Atty Anderson has not surrebuttal.  
10:56 am  Record is closed.  Court addresses jurors as to how they wish to proceed.  
10:56 am  Jury excused from courtroom while Court reviews jury instructions.  
10:58 am  Court takes short break.  

11:09 am  Court in session with Attys and Defendant.  Court has provided interpreters with copy of jury instructions.  The Court has also drafted a cautionary jury instruction.   
11:10 am  Atty Anderson makes record with regard to her review of case law relating to shackles.  Atty Anderson formally makes a motion for a mis-trial.  She does believe a cautionary instruction is appropriate.  Attys are in agreement with the cautionary instruction drafted by the Court.  11:14 am  Atty Johnson makes further record.  11:15 am  Court makes record as to what she observed when Mr. Moreno walked toward witness stand.  Court is denying Motion for a mistrial.  
11:17 am  Court addresses Jury instructions.  Attys do not have anything further with regard to jury instructions.  
11:19 am  Jury seated in courtroom.  Court Instructs the Jury.  
11:49 am  Closing argument by Atty Johnson.  
12:23 pm  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
12:24 pm  Court in recess for approx. 10 minutes;  

12:38 pm  Jury seated in courtroom.  
12:39 pm  Closing argument by Atty Anderson.  
1:11 pm  Rebuttal argument by Atty Johnson.  
1:12 pm  Objection by Atty Anderson.  Jury excused from courtroom.  
1:13 pm  Court hears argument of Attys.  
1:15 pm  Court makes record and precludes reference to Clinton Lewinsky references.  
1:16 pm  Jury seated in courtroom.  Continued argument by Atty Johnson.  
1:19 pm  Court further instructs jury.  
1:21 pm  Clerk names alternate jurors.  Court instructs them they may not discuss the case until verdicts have been reached.  
1:24 pm  Clerks swears Bailiffs.  Jurors excused from courtroom.  
1:25 pm  No objection to instructions as to read to the jury.  
1:25 pm  Court in recess.  

2:53 pm  Court in session with Attys and Defendant.  Jurors have informed Court that they have reached a verdict.  
2:54 pm  Jury seated in courtroom.  
2:55 pm  Court reads verdicts.  Deft found guilty of Cts 1, 2, 3, 4 as charged in the Information;  
2:57 pm  Atty Anderson requests that the jury be polled.  Court polls juror.  Court thanks Jurors for their service.  2:59 pm  Jurors are excused.  
3:00 pm  Motion by State to accept verdicts and enter Judgment of Conviction.  Motion by Atty Anderson for judgment of dismissal notwithstanding the verdict.  
3:00 pm  Court believes there is evdience in the record to support verdicts.  Court enters judgment of convcition on all 4 counts;  PSI ordered.  Bond is REVOKED.  Defendant remanded to custody of Sheriff.  
SENTENCING on:  April 6, 2017 at 10:00 a.m. before Judge Drettwan.  
3:03 pm  Court in recess.

Discussion concerning testimony by defendant's wife and State's objection to certain testimony by the wife.  No one would be allowed to testify as to their thoughts as to why the complainants family might be doing this.  
3:54 pm  Court in recess.

TRANSCRIPT FILED on May 2, 2018. Court Reporter Linda C. Matoska.
Voir Dire List
Voir Dire
Juror Selection and Peremptory Challenges
Seating for 14

9:01 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
INTERPRETERS for Defendant:  Vicki Bermudez and Sarah Chwaszczewski - sworn by Clerk prior to start of trial;  
INTERPRETERS for victim's family:  Claudia Lizarallde and Raul Sosa Cruz;  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Silverio A. Moreno in court, in custody with Atty Michelle Marie Anderson and Co-counsel David Malkus.  
Matter is before the Court for a Jury Trial.  
Discussion between Attorneys with regard to pre-trial issues.  
Atty Anderson asks that Court exclude the prior conviction of the defendant.  
Response by Atty Johnson.  
Court will disallow the prior conviction and finds the prejudice would be unfair.  
Court makes record as to its prior ruling to deny defendant's motion to reconsider.  
Atty Johnson is not filing additional charges for this trial.  
Atty Anderson indicates she and Atty Johnson have an agreement that disciplinary techniques of defendant will not be brought up.  
Atty Anderson makes record with regard to witnesses that she has subpoenaed.  
Atty Johnson has no objection.  
Discussion as to who will be allowed to remain in the courtroom during the trial.  
9:16 am  Court in recess.  

OFF THE RECORD:  Clerk (feefee) takes roll call of Jurors in the Jury Assembly Room; Clerk gives Oath of Competency to Jurors;  Jurors that will be initially seated in jury box are brought up to Courtroom by bailiffs and Clerk seats 24 jurors in jury box.  Remaining jurors are brought up to courtroom by Bailiffs and seated in back of courtroom.  

9:48 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Charges read by Court.  Court gives preliminary instructions.  
9:52 am  Attys introduce themselves, other members of their office and any witnesses they may call.  
9:55 am  Court explains process of voir dire to Jurors.  
9:58 am  Voir dire by Court.  
10:18 am  Court conducts individual voir dire with Juror 3360 - Juror excused.
10:22 am  Jurors 253 and 6440 are excused by Court.  
10:24 am  Voir dire by Attorney Johnson.  Juror 813 is excused.  
10:19 am  Court conducts individual voir dire with Jurors 851 and 5300.  
11:10 am  Continued voir dire by Atty Johnson.  
11:34 am  Court takes short recess.  

11:39 am  Voir dire by Attorney Anderson.  
11:57 am  Atty Anderson moves to strike Juror 4983 for cause - granted.  
11:58 am  Juror 6798 is seated and responds to Court's questions.  
11:59 am  Voir dire of Juror 5300 by Atty Anderson.  
12:00 pm  Atty Anderson moves to strike Juror 5300 - granted;  Court conducts voir dire with Jurors 283 and 5131; Juror 283 is excused.  
12:23 pm  Juror 3092 is seated in Jury box.  Voir dire by Court and Attys.  
12:34 pm  Court conducts individual voir dire with Juror 3092 - Juror is excused.  .  
12:35 pm  Continued voir dire by Atty Anderson.  
12:37 pm  Attorneys take peremptory strikes.  Court explains process to jurors.  
12:49 pm  Clerk reads names of jurors who have been struck.  These jurors are excused.  
12:52 pm  No objection by the Attorneys to the Jury.  
12:52 pm  Clerk swears in Jury panel.  
12:53 pm  Jurors who were not selected are excused at this time.  
12:54 pm  Court reads jury instruction before releasing jury for lunch.  
12:58 pm  Court excuses jurors for lunch hour and asks that they return at 2:15 pm.  
1:00 pm  Court in recess.  

2:18 pm  Same appearances; Jury seated in courtroom;  Court gives further Instructions to the jurors.  
2:20 pm  Court makes record with regard to the interpreting.  Interpreters will go back to using microphones.  
2:26 pm  Opening statement by Atty Johnson.  
2:46 pm  Opening statement by Atty Anderson.  
3:04 pm  Jennifer Ott-Wilson is sworn and testifies on direct exam of Atty Johnson.  
3:24 pm  Cross exam by Attorney Anderson.  

Exhibit 1 marked and identified

3:42 pm  Redirect by Atty Johnson.  
3:45 pm  Witness excused.

Amended
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions

10:36 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Silverio A. Moreno in court, in custody with Atty Michelle Marie Anderson.  
Interpreters Bruce Goodman and Sara Tapia are present in Court and have been sworn by Clerk prior to start of hearing. 
Atty Anderson indicates she has requested that Ms. Tapia interpret for the defendant today because he has difficulty understanding the other interpreter present in Court.  Atty Anderson also indicates there is a conflict with Ms. Tapia and another interpreter with SWITS because of their knowledge of one of the alleged victims in this case - so there would need to be a different interpreter for the defendant for the trial on Monday.  
10:39 am  Atty Johnson makes record as to the last offer conveyed to the defendant.  
10:41 am  Atty Anderson is aware of the offer and it has been conveyed to the defendant.  
10:41 am  Court has colloquy with Mr. Moreno as to his knowledge of the plea agreement.  
10:43 am  Trial is set for 4 days.  Court will seat 2 alternates; 24 jurors will be initially seated in the box and each attorney will get 5 strikes.  State will file proposed jury instructions by the end of the day.  Court advises Attys as to opening instructions the Court will give to the jurors.  
10:45 am  State is requesting exclusion of witnesses with exception of victim, her parents and the court officer.  Any person who may be called as a witness can be present during voir dire.  Other than voir dire all witnesses have to be outside of the courtroom and cannot discuss the case with anyone until they have completed testifying and will not be recalled as a witness.  The exception to not being present in courtroom are the victim, her parents and the State's court officer.  Court requests that any exhibits be pre-marked with Court's clerk if possible.  Court will allow jurors to take notes.  
10:48 am  Attys advise that there are no stipulations that they are aware of.  Court discuss voir dire process with Attys.  
10:52 am  Defendant will have proper clothing for the trial.  
10:53 am  Atty Anderson has only one potential witness that does not appear on the State's witness - the defendant's wife.  
10:55 am  Discussion between Court and Attys concerning what, if any, statements the defendant may have made.  Court addresses whether any witnesses would have criminal records.  Court will have jurors brought upstairs at 9:00 am on Tuesday for voir dire.  
10:58 am  Atty Johnson asks if jurors would be allowed to ask questions?  Atty Anderson would have no objection to this.  Court explains the procedure that the Court would use.  
11:00 am  Court addresses Mr. Moreno and advises him that the State has advised that it may and probably will file an amended information to include additional charges.  Court asks if Mr. Moreno wants more time to speak with his Attorney concerning State's offer.  Defendant states he does not.  
11:03 am  Court in recess.
